title: rustc panicked at 'assertion failed: !substs.has_erasable_regions()'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !substs.has_erasable_regions()', librustc_trans_utils/symbol_names.rs:192:9```

I tried this code:

```rust
#![feature(termination_trait)]

extern crate metaflac     as m_flac;
extern crate mp3_metadata as m_mp3;

use std::env;
use std::error::Error;

fn main() -> Result<(), Box<Error>> {
    let path = env::args().skip(1).next().unwrap();
    let meta = m_mp3::read_from_file(path)?;
    println!("{:?}", meta);

    Ok(())
}
```

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.26.0-nightly (2789b067d 2018-03-06)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 2789b067da2ac921b86199bde21dd231ace1da39
commit-date: 2018-03-06
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.26.0-nightly
LLVM version: 6.0
```

Backtrace:
